summary: This is a transcript of FBI Special Agent testifying before a federal grand jury (Operation Leap Year) regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of a minor victim, identified as , in Palm Beach in February 2005. The agent details the victim's account of the abuse, discrepancies in her statements, and the initial police response. This is a transcript of testimony before a federal grand jury in West Palm Beach, Florida, on February 27, 2007. An FBI agent or law enforcement witness provides details about the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, including controlled phone calls, recruitment of underage girls for massages, and Epstein's own statements about sexual encounters with girls in the presence of their parents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the grand jury investigation. Described as asking girls their age and grade, recruiting them for massages, and boasting about sexual encounters with a young girl in a car while her parents were present.

persons.name: Philip W. May
persons.context: Certified the transcript of the grand jury testimony as a true record of the proceedings.

connections.description: Epstein sexually abused the minor victim during a massage at his home, paying her $300.
Recruited for the massage at Epstein's house, instructed her to lie about her age, and drove her there. was paid $200 for bringing .
Boyfriend of and cousin of . He was present during the initial argument about going to Epstein's.
is identified as Jeffrey Epstein's assistant, handling scheduling and facilitating the victim's visit.
FBI Agent interviewed the victim and is presenting her account to the grand jury.
Detective conducted the initial police interviews with the victim and handled parts of the investigation.

events.title: Initial Recruitment
events.description: At 's house, is on the phone with Epstein's assistant describing . recruits for a paid massage at Epstein's house, causing an argument with .

events.title: Abuse at Epstein's Residence
events.description: and drive to Epstein's Palm Beach home. is taken to a bedroom by the assistant, instructed to undress, and gives Epstein a massage. The encounter involves sexual abuse, after which Epstein pays her $300.

events.title: Police Report and Initial Interview
events.description: 's step-parent calls Palm Beach police to report suspected molestation. Detective interviews .

events.title: Controlled Phone Call
events.description: At the Palm Beach police department, places a controlled call to , who invites her to come work the following Saturday.

events.title: State Grand Jury Testimony
events.description: testifies before a State of Florida grand jury regarding the incident.

events.title: FBI Agent Interview with Victim
events.description: FBI Agent interviews the night before the federal grand jury testimony to discuss discrepancies in her prior statements.

events.title: Federal Grand Jury Testimony
events.description: FBI Special Agent testifies before the federal grand jury (Operation Leap Year) regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: First Controlled Call
events.description: A controlled call was made from an individual (likely a victim or associate) to another person (likely an Epstein associate) at an Olive Garden restaurant. The call involved discussions about a father finding out, reassurance that 'they' did not know about Epstein, and an offer for the caller to return to work for Epstein.

events.title: Second Controlled Calls
events.description: Two controlled calls were made. In the second call, a connection was made. The conversation involved discussions about coming to work for Epstein, with the statement 'The more you do, the more you make,' and talk of a twin sister also coming to Epstein's house.

events.title: Grand Jury Testimony
events.description: A law enforcement witness testified before a federal grand jury in West Palm Beach, Florida, regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's activities involving underage girls.

locations: Olive Garden (workplace of an individual mentioned)
keyFacts: The victim was 14 years old at the time of the abuse in February 2005.
The victim was recruited by her friend , who was paid $200 for bringing her to Epstein's house.
The victim initially withheld some details of the sexual abuse out of embarrassment and fear her father would find out.
Police evidence includes controlled phone call recordings, phone records, and a note with the victim's name found in Epstein's trash.
The FBI agent notes it is typical for young victims of sexual abuse to not initially disclose all details of the activity.
Jeffrey Epstein described a specific incident where he was having sex with a 'young girl' in the back seat of a car while carrying on a conversation with her parents in the front seat.
The investigation used controlled phone calls, recorded by law enforcement, in late March 2006 to gather evidence. These calls discussed girls returning to 'work' for Epstein.
A key victim was recruited at age 17, with phone records showing contact beginning at that age. She was approached at the beach by two individuals about giving Epstein a massage for money.
Epstein asked a girl her age, grade, and school when she came to his house. She stated she was 18 and in the 12th grade.

The witness testified that, based on a victim's appearance and mannerisms at age 16, it was circumstantial evidence that Epstein should have known she was underage, though there was no 'concrete' evidence he knew a specific victim's age.
